  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Finance Lead",
  "description": "At TeamAce, we help businesses across different industries thrive. We work with businesses to create their desired change by getting the right people, designing bespoke business processes, leveraging data, applying insights and technology. We combine our expertise and take different bespoke approaches to solve different business challenges because we believe there is no one size fits all approach. This way, you keep your eyes on the price and thrive.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance Lead

Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time, Hybrid (2 days on-site)

Job Summary


	We are seeking a highly skilled and strategic Finance Lead to take full responsibility for the company&#39;s financial operations.
	This pivotal role involves developing robust financial strategies, overseeing all financial activities, managing risk, and delivering accurate and insightful financial reporting.
	The ideal candidate will be a proven financial management expert with strong analytical abilities and a strategic mindset.


Key&nbsp;Responsibilities
Financial Strategy, Planning &amp; Reporting:


	Develop and manage all in-house financial operations, including detailed budgeting, forecasting, and effective cash flow management.
	Prepare and ensure the timely delivery of accurate monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements and reports.
	Oversee general ledger reconciliations, account postings, and the implementation of strong financial controls.
	Provide executive management with data-driven financial insights to inform strategic and operational decision-making.


Banking, Treasury &amp; Payment Management:


	Serve as the primary liaison with the company&rsquo;s bankers for all financial transactions, account management, and necessary documentation.
	Manage and process payments, fund transfers, and all other approved financial transactions.
	Perform regular bank statement reconciliations to ensure all financial activities are aligned with company policies.
	Monitor and manage cash flow effectively to maintain liquidity for both internal and client-related financial obligations.


Client Financial Services &amp; Account Oversight:


	Supervise the preparation of client management accounts, financial statements, and performance reports.
	Ensure service excellence, compliance with client agreements, and adherence to all reporting timelines and Service Level Agreements (SLAs).
	Offer expert advice to clients on financial performance, risk management, and compliance matters.
	Cultivate and maintain robust relationships with client representatives to ensure high satisfaction and retention.


Compliance, Audit &amp; Statutory Filings:


	Guarantee full compliance with all tax, audit, and financial reporting regulations.
	Oversee all statutory filings, including EMTL and other regulatory submissions, ensuring accuracy and timely completion.
	Coordinate and liaise with external auditors, tax consultants, and regulatory bodies as required.
	Develop, implement, and maintain effective internal audit and risk control processes.


Team Leadership &amp; Development:


	Lead, mentor, and manage the finance team, ensuring accuracy, timeliness, and high accountability in all financial activities.
	Establish clear performance goals and conduct regular performance evaluations for team members.
	Foster and maintain a departmental culture characterised by excellence, integrity, and a commitment to continuous improvement.


Strategic Business Support:


	Conduct detailed financial analysis and provide recommendations to support overall business strategy and growth initiatives.
	Actively participate in key financial activities such as budget planning, developing pricing strategies, and making investment decisions.
	Design and implement financial policies and procedures aimed at enhancing operational efficiency across the organization.


Requirements


	Education: HND / BSc in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field.
	A mandatory professional qualification (e.g., ACCA, ICAN, CFA) is required.
	Experience: A minimum of 4 years of progressive experience in financial management, Finance or Hr Consulting firm, including at least 2 years in a leadership role, preferably within a consulting firm.
	Core Competencies: Proven expertise in financial planning, analysis, and comprehensive reporting.
	Knowledge: Strong grasp of financial principles, accounting standards (IFRS/GAAP), and relevant regulatory requirements.
	Skills: Exceptional analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making capabilities. Proficiency in financial software and ERP systems is essential.
	Attributes: High level of integrity, ethical conduct, and demonstrated ability to lead and motivate a team.
	Communication: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to articulate complex financial information clearly and concisely to diverse audiences.


Salary
N400,000 - N450,000 / month.

What We Offer:


	A competitive compensation and benefits package.
	Significant opportunities for career advancement and professional development.
	A collaborative, supportive, and high-performance work environment.
	The chance to significantly influence the financial trajectory of a dynamic, growing company.

Salary
N400,000 - N450,000 / month.

What We Offer:


	A competitive compensation and benefits package.

  "description": "DreamCity Property &amp; Investment Limited stands at the forefront of residential and commercial real estate development and investment across Nigeria&#39;s major urban centers. We are dedicated to delivering dependable structures supported by qualified infrastructure, premium luxury apartments in high-demand districts, and commercial properties that generate robust returns for our investors. Our continued success is built on a foundation of trust and partnership with our investors, who have become integral to our growth story.

Job Position: Executive Assistant to CEO

Job Location:&nbsp;Jabi, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time&nbsp;&amp; On-Site
Preferred gender: Male

Job Overview


	DreamCity is looking for an accomplished and proactive Executive Assistant who thrives in a high-pressure, fast-paced environment.
	The role is considered a strategic partnership with the CEO and the ideal candidate who will be a seasoned professional with a proven track record in C-suite support and operational efficiency, must possess the flexibility to work extended hours, including weekends and holidays, to meet the demanding schedule of the executive office and will be duly compensated for same.


Key Responsibilities


	Provide comprehensive, high-level administrative and logistical support to the MD, managing a complex and fluid calendar, prioritizing inquiries and requests, and troubleshooting conflicts.
	Act as a key liaison for the MD in business development activities, including preparing pitch decks, conducting preliminary research on potential partners or investments, and assisting with the preparation of business proposals.
	Identify and implement improvements to the MD&#39;s workflow and office operations to enhance productivity and efficiency across the executive office.
	Serve as a primary point of contact between the MD and internal/external stakeholders, including board members, investors, and key regulatory bodies, ensuring professional and effective communication.
	Draft, review, and manage high-level correspondences, communications, presentations, and reports on behalf of the MD with a high degree of discretion and confidentiality.
	Organize and coordinate executive-level meetings, both internal and external, including preparing agendas, taking minutes, and ensuring follow-up on action items. Manage logistics for corporate events as required.
	Oversee and track key projects and initiatives led by the MD, ensuring deadlines are met and objectives are achieved.
	Conduct in-depth research, compile data, and prepare papers for consideration and presentation by the CEO.
	Arrange complex logistics for extensive national and international travel itineraries, including flights, accommodation, and ground transportation, even on short notice at the behest of the CEO
	Handle sensitive and confidential information with the utmost integrity and discretion.


Qualifications and Experience


	A Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Business Administration, Law, Finance, or a related field.
	A minimum of 8 years of proven experience as an Executive Assistant directly supporting a C-Suite executive (MD, COO, CEO, or Group Chairperson).
	Must have verifiable work experience within the real estate development/construction, Finance/investment, or hospitality industries.
	A Master&rsquo;s degree will be a distinct advantage.
	Demonstrable experience in supporting business development initiatives and improving operational efficiency.
	Proven track record of liaising with senior-level stakeholders and regulatory bodies.
	Functional proficiency in use of MS Office Suite and project management tools.
	Must possess an appetite for meeting targets, beating dealines, and be available and willingn to work late hours outside work days/hours often or as deemed necessary.
	Recommended Age bracket: Ages 35 to 45 years.


Preferred Skills &amp; Attributes:


	Impeccable organizational and time-management skills.
	Superior verbal and written communication skills.
	Unflickering discretion and professionalism.
	Proactive, resourceful, and able to operate with a high degree of autonomy.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitment.office@dreamcityproperty.com&nbsp;using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the mail.

Note
Email Content:


	Submit a written (one pager) application letter
	Attach your CV/ Resume
	Attach a professional profile of yourself (one-pager).
